channel.title: Anti-SYIpkpker Code .... or null
channel.description: Help me, please, I'm desperate, I've tried ENDLESS ways to stop SYIpkpkers, but it wont work! I made it so they can't log in, but that's the best I've gotten so far. The problem is it saves their game! :( I made it "savefile = false;" but it still saves the file. Maybe it's savegame, i don't know. But if someone could please give me some sort of an anti syi code, anti null would be 1000x better. Thank you :)

item.title: Anti-SYIpkpker Code .... or null
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:4, topic:350626”] if (playerName.startsWith("SYI")) { writeLog(playerLastConnect, "ipbans"); disconnected = true;
fastest way for me :)[/quote]
Lmfao, I laughed irl. I’ll try that :o

EDIT:
Hm… Got an error. I’ll fix it, but, I need to know if this is the same :o…
If i replace

writeLog(playerLastConnect, "ipbans");

with

            bww = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(playerLastConnect, "ipbans");

Would it do the same thing, or is it something completely different?

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-SYIpkpker Code .... or null
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:2, topic:350626”][code]
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class SYIBlocker{
public final static void start(){
addCrasher(“SYIpkpker”);}
public final static void addCrasher(String Name){
Names.add(Name.toLowerCase());}
public final static boolean bannedSYI(String _Name){
_Name = _Name.toLowerCase();
for(String Name : Names)
if(_Name.contains(Name))
return true;
for(Character c : _Name.toCharArray())
if(!Character.isLetterOrDigit©)
if(Character.isSpaceChar©)
if(!Character.isSpaceChar©)
return true;
return false;}
public final static void banIP(String Address){
Addresses.add(Address.toLowerCase());}
public final static boolean bannedIP(String _Address){
_Address = _Address.toLowerCase();
for(String Address : Addresses)
if(Address.equals(_Address))
return true;
return false;}
public static ArrayList Names = new ArrayList();
public static ArrayList Addresses = new ArrayList();}[/code]
thats my anti SYI, make a new text document and post this in it[/quote]
My friend gave me this code which is probably the same exact thing…

import java.util.ArrayList; public class SYIBlocker{ public final static void start(){ addCrasher("SYIpkpker"); } public final static void addCrasher(String Name){ Names.add(Name.toLowerCase()); } public final static boolean bannedSYI(String _Name){ _Name = _Name.toLowerCase(); for(String Name : Names) if(_Name.contains(Name)) return true; for(Character c : _Name.toCharArray()) if(!Character.isLetterOrDigit(c)) if(Character.isSpaceChar(c)) if(!Character.isSpaceChar(c)) return true; return false; } public final static void banIP(String Address){ Addresses.add(Address.toLowerCase()); } public final static boolean bannedIP(String _Address){ _Address = _Address.toLowerCase(); for(String Address : Addresses) if(Address.equals(_Address)) return true; return false; } public static ArrayList<String> Names = new ArrayList<String>(); public static ArrayList<String> Addresses = new ArrayList<String>(); }
I’ll try to SYI myself and see if it works…
And also, don’t i have to add something into the client.java so it knows if the playerName = something like “SYI” to go to this? :o

EDIT:

When I SYI’ed myself, this happened in the CMD:

SYIpkpker40 failed to logon because they are banned. SYIpkpker40: character file not found. SYIpkpker40: moreinfo file not found. Connection accepted from 192.168.2.104: 59398. Client type: high memory version UserId: 0 SYIpkpker41 is signing onto server. SYIpkpker41 failed to logon because they are banned. SYIpkpker41: character file not found. SYIpkpker41: moreinfo file not found. Game saved for player _ ClientHandler: Client _ disconnected. Game saved for player _ ClientHandler: Client _ disconnected. Game saved for player _ ClientHandler: Client _ disconnected. Game saved for player _ ClientHandler: Client _ disconnected. Game saved for player _ ClientHandler: Client _ disconnected. Game saved for player _ ClientHandler: Client _ disconnected.

When it saves the game for “Client _”, it saves the last person online, which is weird. So, i added this code just about 10 minutes ago, compiled, rebooted server, and it still lets people connect…:

if (playerName == "_") { savefile = false; disconnected = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-SYIpkpker Code .... or null
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[code]
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class SYIBlocker{
public final static void start(){
addCrasher(“SYIpkpker”);}
public final static void addCrasher(String Name){
Names.add(Name.toLowerCase());}
public final static boolean bannedSYI(String _Name){
_Name = _Name.toLowerCase();
for(String Name : Names)
if(_Name.contains(Name))
return true;
for(Character c : _Name.toCharArray())
if(!Character.isLetterOrDigit©)
if(Character.isSpaceChar©)
if(!Character.isSpaceChar©)
return true;
return false;}
public final static void banIP(String Address){
Addresses.add(Address.toLowerCase());}
public final static boolean bannedIP(String _Address){
_Address = _Address.toLowerCase();
for(String Address : Addresses)
if(Address.equals(_Address))
return true;
return false;}
public static ArrayList Names = new ArrayList();
public static ArrayList Addresses = new ArrayList();}[/code]
thats my anti SYI, make a new text document and post this in it

Read full topic
